sub_topic: Estimating the energy emitted in gravitational waves by a supernova explosion.
message_1: What is the order of magnitude of the energy emitted in gravitational waves by a supernova explosion, assuming the explosion releases 10^44 Joules of energy in all directions?
message_2:
The energy emitted in gravitational waves by a supernova explosion is typically a small fraction of the total energy released. It is estimated that around 1% or less of the total energy is emitted in gravitational waves. 

Assuming the explosion releases 10^44 Joules of energy in all directions, the order of magnitude of the energy emitted in gravitational waves would be:

(10^44 Joules) * (0.01) â‰ˆ 10^42 Joules

So, the order of magnitude of the energy emitted in gravitational waves by a supernova explosion is approximately 10^42 Joules.
